text.section: A charitable organization that collects less than $25,000 in charitable contributions from the public in a year need not pay an annual fee, except that, if the charitable organization uses a professional solicitor, it shall pay an annual fee of $50.

section.section: Each charitable organization that submits a separate registration statement and collects at least $25,000 in charitable contributions from the public in a year shall pay an annual fee based on the charitable contributions collected.

An organization failing to file an annual report either by the end of the 6-month period after the end of the charitable organization's fiscal year or within any period of extension granted shall pay, in addition to the annual fee, $25 for each month or part thereof after the date on which the annual report was due to be filed or after the period of extension granted for such filing.

The late fee shall be assessed 60 days after:
the end of the 6th month after the end of the fiscal year; or
the period of extension.
Failure to remit an assessed late fee is a violation of this title.
